name: otterdog
description: Manage GitHub organizations at scale using an infrastructure as code approach

repo.name: otterdog
repo.description: OtterDog is a tool to manage GitHub organizations at scale using a configuration as code approach. It is actively used by the Eclipse Foundation to manage its numerous projects hosted on GitHub.

readme.summary: Well-structured documentation with clear installation and configuration guidance, but lacks troubleshooting content and practical usage examples beyond initial setup.
readme.top_issue: No troubleshooting section or common problems documented; users must navigate errors independently

injection_risks.description: The use of exec() to execute custom hook scripts poses a significant security risk, as it can evaluate arbitrary code. This could lead to code injection attacks if the script contents are not properly sanitized.

The use of exec() to execute custom hook scripts poses a significant security risk, as it can evaluate arbitrary code. This could lead to code injection attacks if the script contents are not properly sanitized.

critical_findings: Code injection vulnerability through custom hook scripts
Potential for error exposure due to DEBUG mode being enabled by default
security.summary: The otterdog package has several security concerns, including code injection vulnerabilities and potential error exposure, which need to be addressed to ensure the security of the application.

common_complaints: Error handling gaps for edge cases (empty status_checks)
Silent failures and lack of validation warnings
CLI-only options that should be in config files
sentiment.summary: Active community with constructive feature requests and bug reports, but some frustration around configuration flexibility and missing validation feedback.

communication.summary: The maintainer responses are clear, helpful, and patient. They provide technical depth while maintaining a welcoming tone.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being today (2026-01-13)
58 open issues with no recent activity or resolution
Zero closed issues in past 6 months indicating no active maintenance
No merged PRs in past 6 months showing no code integration
Zero active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests release process is stalled
positive_signals: Recent commit timestamp exists (though appears to be historical or automated)
maintenance.summary: The otterdog package appears abandoned with no maintenance activity over the past 6 months, despite a recent commit timestamp that is inconsistent with the activity metrics.

changelog.summary: The changelog is well-categorized but lacks clarity and completeness, with no breaking changes or migration guides.

governance.summary: The documentation lacks a succession plan and contributor ladder, posing high risk of bus factor.

project_metrics.description: OtterDog is a tool to manage GitHub organizations at scale using a configuration as code approach. It is actively used by the Eclipse Foundation to manage its numerous projects hosted on GitHub.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is generally well-structured and informative, but lacks troubleshooting information.
